definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
"knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
variant of 尚方劍|尚方剑[shang4 fang1 jian4]/imperial sword (giving bearer arbitrary powers)/in fiction, Chinese version of 007's license to kill

sentences.english: At last his rapier flew into the corner of the room.
sentences.chinese: 最後他的劍飛進來了房屋的角落。

sentences.english: The Soul Reaver is a weapon in the Legacy of Kain series.
sentences.chinese: 搜魂劍是凱恩的遺產系列裏的一把武器。

sentences.english: My cousin Roran and I, we've trained, with swords!
sentences.chinese: 我表哥羅倫和我都練過劍。

sentences.english: Bending the ear of the hedgerow with stories of fire and sword.
sentences.chinese: 吹壓着籬木的耳朵，講述劍與火的故事。

sentences.english: Then they cut him in two with a sharp sword, and left both halves of his body in the middle of the road.
sentences.chinese: 強盜們用一把鋒利的劍把牧師砍成兩截留在了路中央。

sentences.english: The sword has sharp blades, and is able to cut anything.
sentences.chinese: 這把劍的劍鋒很利，真是削鐵如泥。

sentences.english: And we go and we dig up in France and there is the saber,right?
sentences.chinese: 然後我們就去法國，真的挖出了劍？

sentences.english: The sword swallower swallowed a swollen sword.
sentences.chinese: 吞劍人吞了一把膨脹的劍。

sentences.english: A sword is hung above his head.
sentences.chinese: 一枝劍懸掛在他頭的上方。

sentences.english: In High Profile, use your Armed button to unsheathe your sword.
sentences.chinese: 在高姿態時，用你的“武裝”按鍵即可拔出你的劍。

sentences.english: They had carried out their robbery with swords, blades and pistols.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經履行了其與劍，刀和手槍搶劫。

sentences.english: Did your husband get the Emperor's sword?
sentences.chinese: 那駙馬得到皇帝的劍了麼？

sentences.english: Probably she was the woman playing sword in front of the jade!
sentences.chinese: 嗯，多半便是那個在石壁前使劍的女子。

sentences.english: And my sword in the worst fighting has broken.
sentences.chinese: 而我的劍在這次慘烈的戰鬥中已斷。

sentences.english: This was his summing up the spirit of the Liang Jian.
sentences.chinese: 這也是他總結的亮劍精神所在。

sentences.english: The swords have different sizes and shapes.
sentences.chinese: “這些劍有不同的尺寸和形狀”。

definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
point of a spear/edge of a tool/vanguard/forward (in sports team)
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea
